name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Critical Accounting Estimates Our consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States ("U.S. GAAP").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The preparation of financial statements in conformity with U.S. GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Among others, estimates are used when accounting for valuation of investments.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Estimates used in determining fair value measurements include, but are not limited to, expected future cash flow assumptions, market rate assumptions for contractual obligations, actuarial assumptions for benefit plans, settlement plans for litigation and contingencies, and appropriate discount rates.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Estimates and assumptions are evaluated on an ongoing basis and are based on historical and other factors believed to be reasonable under the circumstances.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The results of these estimates may form the basis of the carrying value of certain assets and liabilities and may not be readily apparent from other sources.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Actual results, under conditions and circumstances different from those assumed, may differ from estimates.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We believe the following accounting estimates are critical to our business operations and the understanding of results of operations and affect the more significant judgments and estimates used in the preparation of our consolidated financial statements.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Income Taxes Except as described below, no provision has been made for federal, state, local or foreign income taxes on the results of operations generated by partnership activities as such taxes are the responsibility of the partners.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our corporate subsidiaries account for their income taxes under the asset and liability method.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases and operating loss and tax credit carryforwards.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities of a change in tax rates is recognized in income in the period that includes the enactment date.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Management periodically evaluates all evidence, both positive and negative, in determining whether a valuation allowance to reduce the carrying value of deferred tax assets is still needed.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: For each of December 31, 2024 and 2023, we concluded, based on the projections of taxable income, that certain of our corporate subsidiaries more likely than not

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: will realize a partial benefit from their deferred tax assets and loss carry forwards.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Ultimate realization of the deferred tax assets is dependent upon, among other factors, our corporate subsidiaries' ability to generate sufficient taxable income within the carryforward periods and is subject to change depending on the tax laws in effect in the years in which the carryforwards are used.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: See Note 16, "Income Taxes," to the consolidated financial statements for further discussion regarding our income taxes.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Valuation of Investments The fair value of our investments, including securities sold, not yet purchased, is based on observable market prices when available.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Securities owned by the Investment Funds that are listed on a securities exchange are valued at their last sales price on the primary securities exchange on which such securities are traded on such date.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Securities that are not listed on any exchange but are traded over-the-counter are valued at the mean between the last "bid" and "ask" price for such security on such date.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Securities and other instruments for which market quotes are not readily available are valued at fair value as determined in good faith by the applicable general partner.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: For some investments little market activity may exist; management's determination of fair value is then based on the best information available in the circumstances and may incorporate management's own assumptions and involves a significant degree of judgment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: See Note 6, "Fair Value Measurements" to the consolidated financial statements for further discussion regarding our investments.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Long-Lived Assets and Goodwill We calculate depreciation and amortization on a straight-line basis over the estimated useful lives of the various definite-lived assets.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: When assets are placed in service, we make estimates of what we believe are their reasonable useful lives.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Long-Lived Assets Long-lived assets held and used by our various operating segments and long-lived assets to be disposed of are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate a possible significant deterioration in future expected cash flows that could result in the carrying amount of an asset not being recoverable.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In performing the review for recoverability, we estimate the future cash flows expected to result from the remaining useful life of the asset and its eventual disposition.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Assumptions used in the review of recoverability require the exercise of significant judgment, including judgment about terminal values, growth rates, and the amount and timing of expected future cash flows.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The forecasted cash flows are based on current plans and for years beyond that plan, the estimates are based on assumed growth rates.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: If the sum of the estimated future cash flows, undiscounted and without interest charges, is less than the carrying amount of the asset, a fair value assessment is performed.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: If the carrying amount of the asset exceeds its fair value, an impairment loss is recognized in accordance with U.S. GAAP.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Similarly, long-lived assets to be disposed of are reported at the lower of carrying amount or fair value less cost to sell.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: As of December 31, 2024, our long-lived assets did not have any impairment indicators.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Goodwill Indefinite-lived intangible assets, such as goodwill and trademarks, held by our various segments are reviewed for impairment annually, or more frequently if impairment indicators exist.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Goodwill impairment testing consists of (i) a qualitative analysis to determine whether it is more likely than not that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying amount, including goodwill, and/or, if necessary, (ii) a quantitative analysis which involves comparing the fair value of our reporting units to their respective carrying values.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: If the fair value of the reporting unit exceeds its carrying value, no impairment is necessary.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: If the carrying amount of the reporting unit exceeds its fair value, an impairment loss, equal to the difference (limited to the total amount of goodwill allocated to the tested reporting unit), is recognized in accordance with U.S. GAAP.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: As of December 31, 2024, our consolidated goodwill was $288 million, primarily within our Automotive segment's reporting unit.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We perform the annual goodwill impairment test for our Automotive segment

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: as of October 1 of each year.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: During the third quarter of 2024, we experienced declining sales in our Automotive Services business, due to, among other factors, reduced consumer spending on automotive repairs and maintenance and certain operational challenges, resulting in a reduction in expected future cash flows.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: This led to a goodwill triggering event during the quarter ended September 30, 2024.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our goodwill impairment testing concluded that no impairment was required at that time, and we have undertaken operational changes, including changes in management and strategy, that we believe will lead to improvements in the performance of the business and cash flows.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: However, if our growth and profitability initiatives do not realize their expected benefits, our assets in this business may be subject to impairment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: On October 1, 2024, we performed a qualitative annual goodwill impairment analysis for our Automotive segment, we determined that it was not more likely than not that the fair value of the Service reporting unit was below its carrying amount and therefore, no impairment is required.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: As of December 31, 2024, our Automotive segment had remaining goodwill of $250 million, which is allocated entirely to its reporting unit.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: When performing the quantitative analysis for goodwill impairment testing, we base the fair value of our reporting units on consideration of various valuation methodologies, including projecting future cash flows discounted at rates commensurate with the risks involved ("DCF").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Assumptions used in a DCF require the exercise of significant judgment, including judgment about appropriate discount rates and terminal values, growth rates, and the amount and timing of expected future cash flows.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The forecasted cash flows are based on current plans and for years beyond that plan, the estimates are based on assumed growth rates.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We believe that our assumptions are consistent with the plans and estimates used to manage the underlying businesses.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The discount rates, which are intended to reflect the risks inherent in future cash flow projections, used in a DCF are based on estimates of the weighted-average cost of capital of a market participant.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Such estimates are derived from our analysis of peer companies and consider the industry weighted average return on debt and equity from a market participant perspective.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The inputs used to determine the fair values of our reporting units, including future cash flows, discount rates and growth rates and other assumptions involves a significant degree of judgment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: See Note 11, "Goodwill and Intangible Assets, Net," to the consolidated financial statements for further discussion regarding goodwill and intangible assets.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Recently Issued Accounting Standards See Note 2, "Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies," to the consolidated financial statements for a discussion of recent accounting pronouncements applicable to us.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Our consolidated balance sheets include substantial amounts of assets and liabilities whose fair values are subject to market risks.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Our significant market risks are primarily associated with equity prices, commodity prices, interest rates and foreign currency exchange rates as discussed below.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Equity Price Risk Our predominant exposure to equity price risk is related to our Investment segment and the sensitivities to movements in the fair value of the Investment Funds' investments.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: The fair value of the financial assets and liabilities of the Investment Funds primarily fluctuates in response to changes in the value of securities.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: The net effect of these fair value changes impacts the net gains from investment activities in our consolidated statements of operations.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: The Investment Funds' risk is regularly evaluated and is managed on a position basis as well as on a portfolio basis.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Senior members of our investment team meet on a regular basis to assess and review certain risks, including concentration risk, correlation risk and credit risk for significant positions.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Certain risk metrics and other analytical tools are used in the normal course of business by the Investment segment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: The Investment Funds hold investments that are reported at fair value as of the reporting date, which include securities owned, securities sold, not yet purchased and derivatives as reported in our consolidated balance sheets. Based

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: on their respective balances as of December 31, 2024, we estimate that in the event of a 10% adverse change in the fair value of these investments, the fair values of securities owned, securities sold, not yet purchased and derivatives, based on the price impact on notional value, would decrease by approximately $227 million, $137 million and $409 million, respectively.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: However, as of December 31, 2024, we estimate that the impact to our share of the net gain (loss) from investment activities reported in our consolidated statements of operations would be less than the change in fair value since we have an investment of approximately 64% in the Investment Funds, and the non-controlling interests in income would correspondingly offset approximately 36% of the change in fair value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: As of December 31, 2023, we estimated that in the event of a 10% adverse change in the fair value of these investments, the fair values of securities owned, securities sold, not yet purchased and derivatives, based on the price impact on notional value, would decrease by approximately $290 million, $347 million and $673 million, respectively and as of December 31, 2023, our investment in the Investment Funds was 60%.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Commodity Price Risk CVR Energy, as a manufacturer of refined petroleum and renewable products, and CVR Partners, as a manufacturer of nitrogen fertilizer products, all of which are commodities, have exposure to market pricing for products sold in the future.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: In order to realize value from our Energy segment's processing capacity, a positive spread between the cost of raw materials and the value of finished products must be achieved (i.e., gross margin or crack spread).

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: The physical commodities that comprise our raw materials and finished goods are typically bought and sold at a spot or index price that can be highly variable.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Our Energy segment's petroleum business uses a crude oil purchasing intermediary to purchase the majority of its non-gathered crude oil inventory for the refineries, which allows it to take title to and price its crude oil at locations in close proximity to the refineries, as opposed to the crude oil origination point, reducing its risk associated with volatile commodity prices by shortening the commodity conversion cycle time.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: The commodity conversion cycle time refers to the time elapsed between raw material acquisition and the sale of finished goods.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: In addition, the petroleum business seeks to reduce the variability of commodity price exposure by engaging in hedging strategies and transactions that will serve to protect gross margins as forecasted in the annual operating plan.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: With regard to its hedging activities, CVR Energy may enter into, or has entered into, derivative instruments which serve to: lock in or fix a percentage of the anticipated or planned gross margin in future periods when the derivative market offers commodity spreads that generate positive cash flows; hedge the value of inventories in excess of minimum required inventories; and manage existing derivative positions related to a change in anticipated operations and market conditions.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Interest Rate Risk Our predominant exposure to interest rate risk is related to our operating subsidiaries.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Our operating subsidiaries have variable rate debt primarily with a principal amount outstanding aggregating $483 million as of December 31, 2024, primarily at our Energy and Food Packaging segment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: A 1.0% increase in interest rates would increase interest expense by approximately $5 million on an annualized basis, thus decreasing net income by the same amount.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Additionally, as of December 31, 2024, our operating segments have additional borrowing availability subject to variable interest rates aggregating $306 million, which if outstanding, would increase our operating segments' exposure to changes in interest rates.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Foreign Currency Exchange Rate Risk Certain of our subsidiaries operate in foreign jurisdictions and we transact business in foreign currencies.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: In addition, we may hold investments in common stocks of major multinational companies who have significant foreign business and foreign currency risk of their own.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Our net assets subject to financial statement translation into U.S.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Dollars are primarily in our Food Packaging segment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Food Packaging Viskase has foreign currency exposures related to buying, selling, and financing in currencies other than the local currencies in which they operate.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Viskase is exposed to foreign currency risk due to the translation and remeasurement of the results of certain international operations into U.S.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Dollars as part of the consolidation process.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates can therefore create volatility in the results of operations and may adversely affect Viskase's financial condition.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Viskase recorded a translation loss of $7 million and a gain of $5 million in accumulated other comprehensive loss for the years ended December 31, 2024 and 2023, respectively, and recorded translation losses in earnings of $9 million and $3 million for the years ended December 31, 2024 and 2023, respectively.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Credit Risk We and the Investment Funds are subject to certain inherent risks through our investments.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Our entities typically invest excess cash in large money market funds.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: The money market funds primarily invest in government securities and other short-term, highly liquid instruments with a low risk of loss.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: The Investment Funds also maintain free credit balances with their prime brokers and in interest bearing accounts at major banking institutions.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: We seek to diversify our cash investments across several accounts and institutions and monitor performance and counterparty risk.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: The Investment Funds and, to a lesser extent, other entities hold derivative instruments that are subject to credit risk in the event that the counterparties are unable to meet the terms of such agreements.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: When the Investment Funds make such investments or enter into other arrangements where they might suffer a significant loss through the default or insolvency of a counterparty, we monitor the credit quality of such counterparty and seek to do business with creditworthy counterparties.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Counterparty risk is monitored by obtaining and reviewing public information filed by the counterparties and others.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: Compliance Program Price Risk As a producer of transportation fuels from petroleum, our Energy segment's obligated-party subsidiaries are required to blend biofuels into the transportation fuels they produce or to purchase RINs in the open market in lieu of blending to meet the mandates established by the EPA, unless such blending obligations are waived by the EPA.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: CVR Energy's obligated-party subsidiaries are exposed to market risk related to volatility in the price of RINs needed to comply with the Renewable Fuel Standards.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
section_name: Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
sentence: See Note 19, "Commitments and Contingencies," to the consolidated financial statements for further discussion about compliance with the Renewable Fuel Standards.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Item 8 Financial Statements and Supplementary Data REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM Board of Directors and Partners Icahn Enterprises L.P.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Opinion on the financial statements We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Icahn Enterprises L.P. (a Delaware limited partnership) and subsidiaries (the "Partnership") as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, the related consolidated statements of operations, comprehensive loss, changes in equity, and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2024, and the related notes and financial statement schedule included under Item 15(a)(2) (collectively referred to as the "consolidated financial statements").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the Partnership as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2024, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States) ("PCAOB"), the Partnership's internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2024, based on criteria established in the 2013 Internal Control-Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission ("COSO"), and our report dated February 26, 2025 expressed an unqualified opinion.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Basis for opinion These consolidated financial statements are the responsibility of the Partnership's management.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the Partnership's consolidated financial statements based on our audits.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We are a public accounting firm registered with the PCAOB and are required to be independent with respect to the Partnership in accordance with the U.S. federal securities laws and the applicable rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission and the PCAOB.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the PCAOB.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement, whether due to error or fraud.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our audits included performing procedures to assess the risks of material misstatement of the financial statements, whether due to error or fraud, and performing procedures that respond to those risks.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Such procedures included examining, on a test basis, evidence regarding the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our audits also included evaluating the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall presentation of the financial statements.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Critical audit matters Critical audit matters are matters arising from the current period audit of the financial statements that were communicated or required to be communicated to the audit committee and that: (1) relate to accounts or disclosures that are material to the financial statements and (2) involved our especially challenging, subjective, or complex judgments.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We determined that there are no critical audit matters.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: /s/GRANT THORNTON LLP We have served as the Partnership's auditor since 2004.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 1.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Description of Business Overview Icahn Enterprises L.P. ("Icahn Enterprises") is a master limited partnership formed in Delaware on February 17, 1987.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: References to "we," "our", "us" or "the Company" herein include Icahn Enterprises and its subsidiaries, unless the context otherwise requires.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Icahn Enterprises owns a 99% limited partner interest in Icahn Enterprises Holdings L.P. ("Icahn Enterprises Holdings").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Icahn Enterprises Holdings and its subsidiaries own substantially all of our assets and liabilities and conduct substantially all of our operations.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Icahn Enterprises G.P.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Inc. ("Icahn Enterprises GP"), which is indirectly owned and controlled by Mr. Carl C. Icahn, owns a 1% general partner interest in each of Icahn Enterprises and Icahn Enterprises Holdings as of December 31, 2024, representing an aggregate 1.99% general partner interest in Icahn Enterprises Holdings and us.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Mr. Icahn and his affiliates owned approximately 86% of our outstanding depositary units as of December 31, 2024.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Description of Operating Businesses We are a diversified holding company owning subsidiaries currently engaged in the following continuing operating businesses: Investment, Energy, Automotive, Food Packaging, Real Estate, Home Fashion and Pharma.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We also report the results of our Holding Company, which includes the results of certain subsidiaries of Icahn Enterprises (unless otherwise noted), and investment activity and expenses associated with our Holding Company.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: See Note 15, "Segment and Geographic Reporting," for a reconciliation of each of our reporting segment's results of operations to our consolidated results.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Certain additional information with respect to our segments is discussed below.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Investment Our Investment segment is comprised of various private investment funds ("Investment Funds") in which we have general partner interests and through which we invest our proprietary capital.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: As general partner, we provide investment advisory and certain administrative and back-office services to the Investment Funds but do not provide such services to any other entities, individuals or accounts.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We and certain of Mr. Icahn's family members and affiliates are the only investors in the Investment Funds.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Interests in the Investment Funds are not offered to outside investors.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We had interests in the Investment Funds with a fair value of approximately $2.7 billion and $3.2 billion as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, respectively.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Energy We conduct our Energy segment through our majority owned subsidiary, CVR Energy, Inc. ("CVR Energy"), along with a 2% interest in common units of CVR Partners, LP held outside of CVR Energy.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: CVR Energy is headquartered in Sugar Land, Texas.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: CVR Energy is a diversified holding company primarily engaged in the petroleum refining and marketing businesses, the renewable fuels businesses as well as in the nitrogen fertilizer manufacturing and distribution businesses through its holdings in CVR Partners, LP, a publicly traded limited partnership ("CVR Partners").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: CVR Energy is an independent petroleum refiner and marketer of high value transportation fuels primarily in the form of gasoline, diesel, jet fuel and distillates.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The renewables business refines renewable feedstocks, such as soybean oil, corn oil, and other related renewable feedstocks, into renewable diesel, and markets renewable products.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: CVR Partners produces and markets nitrogen fertilizers in the form of urea ammonium nitrate ("UAN") and ammonia.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: CVR Energy holds 100% of the general partner interest and approximately 37% of the outstanding common units of CVR Partners as of December 31, 2024.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: As of December 31, 2024, we owned approximately 66% of the total outstanding common stock of CVR Energy and 2% of the outstanding common units of CVR Partners.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS Automotive We conduct our Automotive segment through various subsidiaries, Icahn Automotive Group LLC ("Icahn Automotive") and AEP PLC LLC ("AEP PLC").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The Automotive segment is engaged in providing a full range of automotive repair and maintenance services, along with the sale of any installed parts or materials related to automotive services ("Automotive Services") to its customers, as well as sales of automotive aftermarket parts and retailed merchandise ("Aftermarket Parts").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In addition to its primary businesses, the Automotive segment leases available and excess real estate in certain locations under long-term operating leases.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: On January 31, 2023, a subsidiary of Icahn Automotive, IEH Auto Parts Holding LLC and its subsidiaries (collectively "Auto Plus"), an aftermarket parts distributor held within our Automotive segment, filed voluntary petitions in the United States Bankruptcy Court.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: As a result of Auto Plus' filings for bankruptcy protections on January 31, 2023, we no longer controlled the operations of Auto Plus, and therefore, we deconsolidated Auto Plus as of January 31, 2023.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: See Note 3, "Subsidiary Bankruptcy and Deconsolidation", for a detailed discussion of the Auto Plus bankruptcy and deconsolidation.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Food Packaging We conduct our Food Packaging segment through our majority owned subsidiary, Viskase Companies, Inc. ("Viskase").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Viskase is a producer of cellulosic, fibrous and plastic casings used to prepare and package processed meat products.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: As of December 31, 2024, we owned approximately 91% of the total outstanding common stock of Viskase.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Real Estate We conduct our Real Estate segment through various wholly owned subsidiaries.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our Real Estate segment consists of investment properties which includes land, retail, office and industrial properties leased to corporate tenants, the development and sale of single-family homes, and the operations of a resort and two country clubs.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Home Fashion We conduct our Home Fashion segment through our wholly-owned subsidiary, WestPoint Home LLC ("WPH"). WPH's business consists of manufacturing, sourcing, marketing, distributing and selling home fashion consumer products.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Pharma We conduct our Pharma segment through our wholly owned subsidiary, Vivus LLC, formerly Vivus, Inc. ("Vivus").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Vivus is a specialty pharmaceutical company with two approved therapies and two product candidates in active clinical development and two product candidates in early-stage development.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: 2. Basis of Presentation and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The audited consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States ("U.S. GAAP").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We conduct and plan to continue to conduct our activities in such a manner as not to be deemed an investment company under the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (the "Investment Company Act").

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Therefore, no more than 40% of our total assets can be invested in investment securities, as such term is defined in the Investment Company Act.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In addition, we do not invest or intend to invest in securities as our primary business.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We structure and intend to continue structuring our investments to be taxed as a partnership rather than as a corporation under the applicable publicly traded partnership rules of the Internal Revenue Code, as amended.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS Events beyond our control, including significant appreciation or depreciation in the market value of certain of our publicly traded holdings or adverse developments with respect to our ownership of certain of our subsidiaries, could result in our inadvertently becoming an investment company that is required to register under the Investment Company Act.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our sales of Federal-Mogul LLC, Tropicana Entertainment Inc., American Railcar Industries, Inc., Ferrous Resources Ltd., and PSC Metals in recent years did not result in our being considered an investment company.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: However, additional transactions involving the sale of certain assets could result in our being considered an investment company.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Following such events or transactions, an exemption under the Investment Company Act would provide us up to one year to take steps to avoid becoming classified as an investment company.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We expect to take steps to avoid becoming classified as an investment company, but no assurance can be made that we will successfully be able to take the steps necessary to avoid becoming classified as an investment company.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Principles of Consolidation Our consolidated financial statements include the accounts of (i) Icahn Enterprises and (ii) the wholly and majority owned subsidiaries of Icahn Enterprises, in addition to variable interest entities ("VIEs") in which we are the primary beneficiary.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In evaluating whether we have a controlling financial interest in entities that we consolidate, we consider the following: (1) for voting interest entities, including limited partnerships and similar entities that are not VIEs, we consolidate these entities in which we own a majority of the voting interests; and (2) for VIEs, we consolidate these entities in which we are the primary beneficiary.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: See below for a discussion of our VIEs.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Kick-out rights, which are the rights underlying the limited partners' ability to dissolve the limited partnership or otherwise remove the general partners, held through voting interests of partnerships and similar entities that are not VIEs are considered the equivalent of the equity interests of corporations that are not VIEs.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: For entities over which the Company does not have significant influence, the Company accounts for its equity investment at fair value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Except for our Investment segment and Holding Company, for equity investments in which we own 50% or less but greater than 20%, we generally account for such investments using the equity method.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: All other equity investments are accounted for at fair value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Consolidated Variable Interest Entities We determined that Icahn Enterprises Holdings is a VIE because it is a limited partnership that lacks both substantive kick-out and participating rights.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Although Icahn Enterprises is not the general partner of Icahn Enterprises Holdings, Icahn Enterprises is deemed to be the primary beneficiary of Icahn Enterprises Holdings principally based on its 99% limited partner interest in Icahn Enterprises Holdings, as well as our related party relationship with the general partner, and therefore continues to consolidate Icahn Enterprises Holdings.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Icahn Enterprises Holdings and its subsidiaries own substantially all of our assets and liabilities and therefore, the balance sheets of Icahn Enterprises and Icahn Enterprises Holdings are substantially the same.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: During 2023, we established a captive insurance program to supplement the insurance coverage of the officers, directors, employees and agents of the Company, its subsidiaries and our general partner, in addition to our newly established commercial insurance program.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We hold assets in a protected cell, which we are the primary beneficiary of, and therefore consolidate the protected cell.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: At December 31, 2024, total assets related to the protected cell were $108 million and included in restricted cash in the consolidated balance sheet.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Discontinued Operations and Assets Held For Sale We classify assets and liabilities as held for sale when management, having the authority to approve the action, commits to a plan to sell the disposal group, the sale is probable within one year, and the disposal group is available for immediate sale in its present condition.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We also consider whether an active program to locate a buyer has been initiated, whether the disposal group is marketed actively for sale at a price that is reasonable in relation to its current fair value,

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS and whether actions required to complete the plan indicate it is unlikely significant changes to the plan will be made or the plan will be withdrawn.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our assets held for sale were $25 million as of December 31, 2024, all of which relates to certain properties in our Real Estate segment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In November 2024, we entered into a purchase and sale agreement to sell certain properties, which is expected to close in the first quarter of 2025.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In accordance with U.S. GAAP, we classify operations as discontinued when they meet all the criteria to be classified as held for sale and when the sale represents a strategic shift that will have a major impact on our financial condition and results of operations.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Use of Estimates in Preparation of Financial Statements The preparation of the consolidated financial statements in conformity with U.S. GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amount of assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amount of revenues and expenses during the period.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Due to the inherent uncertainty involved in making estimates, actual results may differ from the estimates and assumptions used in preparing the consolidated financial statements.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Reclassifications Certain reclassifications from the prior year presentation have been made to conform to the current year presentation, which did not have an impact on previously reported net income and equity and are not deemed material.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Fair Value of Financial Instruments The carrying values of cash and cash equivalents, cash held at consolidated affiliated partnerships and restricted cash, accounts receivable, due from brokers, accounts payable, accrued expenses and other liabilities and due to brokers are deemed to be reasonable estimates of their fair values because of their short-term nature.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: See Note 5, "Investments," and Note 6, "Fair Value Measurements," for a detailed discussion of our investments and other non-financial assets and/or liabilities.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The fair value of our long-term debt is based on the quoted market prices for the same or similar issues or on the current rates offered to us for debt of the same remaining maturities.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The carrying value and estimated fair value of our debt as of December 31, 2024 was approximately $6.8 billion and $6.6 billion, respectively.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The carrying value and estimated fair value of our debt as of December 31, 2023 was approximately $7.2 billion and $6.9 billion, respectively.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Acquisitions of Businesses We account for business combinations under the acquisition method of accounting (other than acquisitions of businesses under common control), which requires us to recognize separately from goodwill the assets acquired and the liabilities assumed at their acquisition date fair values.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: While we use our best estimates and assumptions to accurately value assets acquired and liabilities assumed at the acquisition date as well as contingent consideration, where applicable, our estimates are inherently uncertain and subject to refinement.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Accounting for business combinations requires us to make significant estimates and assumptions, especially at the acquisition date including our estimates for intangible assets, contractual obligations assumed, pre-acquisition contingencies, and contingent consideration, where applicable.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In valuing our acquisitions, we estimate fair values based on industry data and trends and by reference to relevant market rates and transactions, and discounted cash flow valuation methods, among other factors.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The discount rates used were commensurate with the inherent risks associated with each type of asset and the level and timing of cash flows appropriately reflect market participant assumptions.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS primary items that generate goodwill include the value of the synergies between the acquired company and our existing businesses and the value of the acquired assembled workforce, neither of which qualifies for recognition as an intangible asset.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Acquisition, Investments and Disposition of Entities under Common Control

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Acquisitions of or investments in entities under common control are reflected in a manner similar to pooling of interests.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The general partner's capital account or non-controlling interests, as applicable, are charged or credited for the difference between the consideration we pay for the entity and the related entity's basis prior to our acquisition or investment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Net gains or losses of an acquired entity prior to its acquisition or investment date are allocated to the general partner's capital account or non-controlling interests, as applicable.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In allocating gains and losses upon the sale of a previously acquired common control entity, we allocate a gain or loss for financial reporting purposes by first restoring the general partner's capital account or non-controlling interests, as applicable, for the cumulative charges or credits relating to prior periods recorded at the time of our acquisition or investment and then allocating the remaining gain or loss ("Common Control Gains or Losses") among our general partner, limited partners and non-controlling interests, as applicable, in accordance with their respective ownership percentages.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In the case of acquisitions of entities under common control, such Common Control Gains or Losses are allocated in accordance with their respective partnership percentages under the Amended and Restated Agreement of Limited Partnership dated as of May 12, 1987, as amended from time to time (together with the partnership agreement of Icahn Enterprises Holdings, the "Partnership Agreement") (i.e., 98.01% to the limited partners and 1.99% to the general partner).

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Cash Flow Cash and cash equivalents and restricted cash and restricted cash equivalents in our consolidated statements of cash flows is comprised of (i) cash and cash equivalents and (ii) cash held at consolidated affiliated partnerships and restricted cash.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Cash and Cash Equivalents We consider short-term investments, which are highly liquid with original maturities of three months or less at date of purchase, to be cash equivalents.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: As of December 31, 2023, our cash and cash equivalents balance included $598 million of reserved funds at our Energy segment to be utilized for the repayment of our Energy segment's 5.250% senior unsecured notes due 2025.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Cash Held at Consolidated Affiliated Partnerships and Restricted Cash

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our cash held at consolidated affiliated partnerships balance was $0.9 billion and $1.1 billion as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, respectively.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Cash held at consolidated affiliated partnerships relates to our Investment segment and consists of cash and cash equivalents held by the Investment Funds that, although not legally restricted, are not used for the general operating needs of Icahn Enterprises.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our restricted cash balance was $1.7 billion and $1.9 billion as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, respectively.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Restricted cash includes, but is not limited to, our Investment segment's cash pledged and held for margin requirements on derivative transactions and cash held related to our captive insurance program.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Investments and Related Transactions Investment Investment Transactions and Related Investment Income (Loss).

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Investment transactions of the Investment Funds are recorded on a trade date basis.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Realized gains or losses on sales of investments are based on the first-in, first-out or

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS the specific identification method.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Realized and unrealized gains or losses on investments are recorded in the consolidated statements of operations.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Interest income and expenses are recorded on an accrual basis and dividends are recorded on the ex-dividend date.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Premiums and discounts on fixed income securities are amortized using the effective yield method.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Investments held by our Investment segment are carried at fair value. Our Investment segment applies the fair value option to those investments that are otherwise subject to the equity method of accounting.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Valuation of Investments.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Securities of the Investment Funds that are listed on a securities exchange are valued at their last sales price on the primary securities exchange on which such securities are traded on such date.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Securities that are not listed on any exchange but are traded over-the-counter are valued at the mean between the last "bid" and "ask" price for such security on such date.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Securities and other instruments for which market quotes are not readily available are valued at fair value as determined in good faith by the Investment Funds.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Foreign Currency Transactions.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The books and records of the Investment Funds are maintained in U.S. dollars.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than U.S. dollars are translated into U.S. dollars at the rate of exchange in effect at the balance sheet date.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Transactions during the period denominated in currencies other than U.S. dollars are translated at the rate of exchange applicable on the date of the transaction.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Foreign currency translation gains and losses are recorded in the consolidated statements of operations.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The Investment Funds do not isolate that portion of the results of operations resulting from changes in foreign exchange rates on investments from the fluctuations arising from changes in the market prices of securities.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Such fluctuations are reflected in net gain (loss) from investment activities in the consolidated statements of operations.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Fair Values of Financial Instruments. The fair values of the Investment Funds' assets and liabilities that qualify as financial instruments under applicable U.S. GAAP approximate the carrying amounts presented in the consolidated balance sheets.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Securities Sold, Not Yet Purchased.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The Investment Funds may sell an investment they do not own in anticipation of a decline in the fair value of that investment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: When the Investment Funds sell an investment short, they must borrow the investment sold short and deliver it to the broker-dealer through which they made the short sale.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: A gain, limited to the price at which the Investment Funds sold the investment short, or a loss, unlimited in amount, will be recognized upon the cover of the short sale.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Due From Brokers.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Due from brokers represents cash balances with the Investment Funds' clearing brokers, prime brokers, and derivative counterparties.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: These funds as well as fully-paid for and marginable securities are essentially restricted to the extent that they serve as collateral against securities sold, not yet purchased.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Due from brokers may also include unrestricted balances with derivative counterparties.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Due To Brokers. Due to brokers represents margin debit balances collateralized by certain of the Investment Funds' investments in securities.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Other Segments and Holding Company Investments in equity securities are carried at fair value with the unrealized gains or losses reflected in the consolidated statements of operations.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: For purposes of determining gains and losses, the cost of securities is based on specific identification.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Dividend income is recorded on the ex-dividend date and interest income is recognized when earned.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS Fair Value Option for Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The fair value option gives entities the option to measure eligible financial assets, financial liabilities and firm commitments at fair value (i.e., the fair value option), on an instrument-by-instrument basis, that are otherwise not permitted to be accounted for at fair value pursuant to the provisions of the Financial Accounting Standards Board ("FASB") Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") Topic 825, Financial Instruments.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The election to use the fair value option is available when an entity first recognizes a financial asset or financial liability or upon entering into a firm commitment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Subsequent changes in fair value must be recorded in earnings.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In estimating the fair value for financial instruments for which the fair value option has been elected, we use the valuation methodologies in accordance to where the financial instruments are classified within the fair value hierarchy as discussed in Note 6, "Fair Value Measurements."

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: For our Investment segment, we apply the fair value option to our investments that would otherwise be accounted under the equity method.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Derivatives From time to time, our subsidiaries enter into derivative contracts, including purchased and written option contracts, swap contracts, futures contracts and forward contracts.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: U.S. GAAP requires recognition of all derivatives as either assets or liabilities in the balance sheet at their fair value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The accounting for changes in fair value depends on the intended use of the derivative and its resulting designation.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: For those derivative instruments that are designated and qualify as hedging instruments, a company must designate the hedging instrument, based upon the exposure being hedged, as a fair value hedge, cash flow hedge or a hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Gains and losses related to a hedge are either recognized in income immediately to offset the gain or loss on the hedged item or are deferred and reported as a component of accumulated other comprehensive loss and subsequently recognized in earnings when the hedged item affects earnings.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The change in fair value of the ineffective portion of a financial instrument, determined using the hypothetical derivative method, is recognized in earnings immediately.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The gain or loss related to financial instruments that are not designated as hedges are recognized immediately in earnings.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Cash flows related to hedging activities are included in the operating section of the consolidated statements of cash flows.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: For further information regarding our derivative contracts, see Note 7, "Financial Instruments."

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Accounts Receivable, Net Accounts receivable, net consists of trade receivables from customers, including contract assets when we have an unconditional right to receive consideration.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: An allowance is based on historical loss experience, expected credit losses from current economic conditions, and management's expectations of future economic conditions.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Inventories Energy Our Energy segment inventories consist primarily of domestic and foreign crude oil, blending stock and components, work in progress, fertilizer products, refined fuels and by-products and renewable diesel, all of which are valued at the lower of first-in, first-out ("FIFO") basis method cost or net realizable value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Other inventories, including other raw materials, spare parts and supplies, are valued at the lower of moving-average cost, which approximates FIFO, or net realizable value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The cost of inventories includes inbound freight costs.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Automotive, Food Packaging, Home Fashion and Pharma Our Automotive, Food Packaging, Home Fashion and Pharma segments' inventories are stated at the lower of cost or net realizable value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Cost is determined by using the FIFO method, except for our Automotive segment which uses the last-in, first out ("LIFO") method and the Pharma segment which utilizes weighted-average cost.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Inventory recorded using the LIFO method was $168 million and $228 million as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, respectively, all of which

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS relates to finished goods.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The cost of manufactured goods includes the cost of direct materials, labor and manufacturing overhead.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our Automotive, Food Packaging, Home Fashion and Pharma segments write-down inventory for estimated excess, slow-moving and obsolete inventory as well as inventory whose carrying value is in excess of net realizable value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Long-Lived Assets Long-lived assets such as property, plant, and equipment, and definite-lived intangible assets are recorded at cost or fair value established at acquisition, less accumulated depreciation or amortization, unless the expected future use of the assets indicate a lower value is appropriate.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Long-lived assets are evaluated for impairment when impairment indicators exist.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: An evaluation of impairment consists of reviewing the carrying value of a long-lived asset for recoverability.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Recoverability of long-lived assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of an asset to estimated undiscounted future net cash flows expected to be generated by the asset.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: If the carrying value of a long-lived asset is not determined to be recoverable, a fair value assessment is performed.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: If the carrying amount of the asset exceeds its fair value, an impairment loss is recognized in accordance with U.S. GAAP.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Depreciation and amortization are computed principally by the straight-line method for financial reporting purposes.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: During the second quarter of 2023, a significant tenant of a commercial high-rise property within our Real Estate segment was notified of default for non-payment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The tenant was unable to cure the default status and the lease was terminated.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We considered this default, along with other facts and circumstances, a triggering event for potential impairment and we assessed the carrying value of this long-lived asset for recoverability using the undiscounted cash flow method during the second quarter of 2023.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: We determined the total undiscounted cash flows of the property exceeded its carrying value and therefore, no impairment is required.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Land and construction in progress are stated at the lower of cost or net realizable value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Interest is capitalized on expenditures for long-term projects until a salable or ready-for-use condition is reached.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The interest capitalization rate is based on the interest rate on specific borrowings to fund the projects.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Costs for planned major maintenance activities ("turnarounds") for our Energy segment represent major maintenance activities that require shutdown of significant parts of a plant to perform necessary inspection, cleaning, repairs, and replacement of assets.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Our Energy segment's turnaround expenditures are deferred for its petroleum business and expensed as incurred for its nitrogen fertilizer business.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Turnarounds generally occur every four to five years for our Energy segment's refineries and generally every three years for its nitrogen fertilizer plants.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Deferred turnaround costs, net of accumulated amortization, are included in other assets in the consolidated financial statements.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Goodwill and Indefinite-Lived Intangible Assets Goodwill and indefinite-lived intangible assets primarily include trademarks and brand names acquired in acquisitions.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: For a complete discussion of the impairment of goodwill and indefinite-lived intangible assets related to our various segments, see Note 11, "Goodwill and Intangible Assets, Net."

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Goodwill Goodwill is determined as the excess of the fair value of consideration transferred in a business combination over the net amounts of identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Goodwill is reviewed for impairment annually, or more frequently if impairment indicators exist.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: An impairment exists when a reporting unit's carrying value exceeds its fair value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: When performing the goodwill impairment testing, we first consider qualitative factors to determine if it is more likely than not that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying amount.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Qualitative factors include considering macroeconomic conditions, industry and market conditions, overall financial performance and other factors.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: If necessary, a quantitative impairment test is performed.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: When a quantitative impairment test is performed, a reporting units' fair value is based on valuation techniques using the best available information, primarily discounted cash flow

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS projections, guideline transaction multiples, and multiples of current and future earnings.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The impairment charge, if any, is the excess of the tested reporting unit's carrying value over its fair value, limited to the total amount of goodwill allocated to the tested reporting unit.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Indefinite-Lived Intangible Assets Indefinite-lived intangible assets are stated at fair value established at acquisition or cost.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: These indefinite-lived intangible assets are reviewed for impairment annually, or more frequently if impairment indicators exist.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: An impairment exists when a trademark or brand names' carrying value exceeds its fair value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The fair values of these assets are based upon the prospective stream of hypothetical after-tax royalty cost savings discounted at rates that reflect the rates of return appropriate for these intangible assets.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In the fourth quarter of 2023, our Automotive segment recognized an impairment charge of $7 million, representing the excess of the assets' carrying value over their fair value.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Pension and Other Post-Retirement Benefit Plan Obligations Post-retirement benefit liabilities were $25 million and $34 million as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, respectively, and are included in accrued expenses and other liabilities in our consolidated balance sheets.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Appropriate actuarial methods and assumptions are used in accounting for defined benefit pension plans and other post-retirement benefit plans.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: These assumptions include long-term rate of return on plan assets, discount rates and other factors.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Actual results that differ from the assumptions used are accumulated and amortized over future periods.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Therefore, assumptions used to calculate benefit obligations as of the end of the year directly impact the expense to be recognized in future periods.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The measurement date for all defined benefit plans is December 31 of each year.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Accumulated Other Comprehensive Loss Accumulated other comprehensive loss is included in the limited partners and general partner components of equity in the consolidated balance sheets in the amounts of $61 million and $55 million as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, respectively.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Refer to Note 17, "Changes in Accumulated Other Comprehensive Loss," for further information.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Allocation of Net Profits and Losses in Consolidated Affiliated Partnerships

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Net investment income and net realized and unrealized gains and losses on investments of the Investment Funds are allocated to the respective partners of the Investment Funds based on their percentage ownership in such Investment Funds on a monthly basis.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Except for our limited partner interest, such allocations made to the limited partners of the Investment Funds are represented as non-controlling interests in our consolidated statements of operations.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: General Partnership Interest of Icahn Enterprises The general partner's capital account generally consists of its cumulative share of our net income less cash distributions plus capital contributions.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Additionally, in acquisitions of common control companies accounted for at historical cost similar to a pooling of interests, the general partner's capital account would be charged (or credited) in a manner similar to a distribution (or contribution) for the excess (or deficit) of the fair value of consideration paid over historical basis in the business acquired.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Capital Accounts, as defined under the Partnership Agreement, are maintained for our general partner and our limited partners.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The capital account provisions of our Partnership Agreement incorporate principles established for U.S. federal income tax purposes and are not comparable to the equity accounts reflected under U.S. GAAP in our consolidated financial statements.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Under our Partnership Agreement, the general partner is required to make additional capital contributions to us upon the issuance of any additional depositary units in order to maintain a capital account balance equal to 1.99% of the total capital accounts of all partners.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS Generally, net earnings for U.S. federal income tax purposes are allocated 1.99% and 98.01% between the general partner and the limited partners, respectively, in the same proportion as aggregate cash distributions made to the general partner and the limited partners during the period.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: This is generally consistent with the manner of allocating net income under our Partnership Agreement; however, it is not comparable to the allocation of net income reflected in our consolidated financial statements.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Pursuant to the Partnership Agreement, in the event of our dissolution, after satisfying our liabilities, our remaining assets would be divided among our limited partners and the general partner in accordance with their respective percentage interests under the Partnership Agreement.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: If a deficit balance still remains in the general partner's capital account after all allocations are made between the partners, the general partner would not be required to make whole any such deficit.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Basic and Diluted Income Per LP Unit For Icahn Enterprises, basic income (loss) per LP unit is based on net income or loss attributable to Icahn Enterprises allocated to limited partners.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Net income or loss allocated to limited partners is divided by the weighted-average number of LP units outstanding.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Diluted income (loss) per LP unit, when applicable, is based on basic income (loss) adjusted for the potential effect of dilutive securities as well as the related weighted-average number of units and equivalent units outstanding.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: For accounting purposes, when applicable, earnings prior to dates of acquisitions of entities under common control are excluded from the computation of basic and diluted income per LP unit as such earnings are allocated to our general partner.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Income Taxes Except as described below, no provision has been made for federal, state, local or foreign income taxes on the results of operations generated by partnership activities, as such taxes are the responsibility of the partners.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Provision has been made for federal, state, local or foreign income taxes on the results of operations generated by our corporate subsidiaries and these are reflected within continuing and discontinued operations.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases and operating loss and tax credit carry forwards.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities of a change in tax rates is recognized in income in the period that includes the enactment date.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Deferred tax assets are limited to amounts considered to be realizable in future periods.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: A valuation allowance is recorded against deferred tax assets if management does not believe that we have met the "more-likely-than-not" standard to allow recognition of such an asset.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: U.S. GAAP provides that the tax effects from an uncertain tax position can be recognized in the financial statements only if the position is "more-likely-than-not" to be sustained if the position were to be challenged by a taxing authority.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The assessment of the tax position is based solely on the technical merits of the position, without regard to the likelihood that the tax position may be challenged.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: If an uncertain tax position meets the "more-likely-than-not" threshold, the largest amount of tax benefit that is greater than 50 percent likely to be recognized upon ultimate settlement with the taxing authority is recorded.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: See Note 16, "Income Taxes," for additional information.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Leases The determination of whether an arrangement is or contains a lease occurs at inception. We account for arrangements that contain lease and non-lease components as a single lease component for all classes of underlying

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P. AND SUBSIDIARIES NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS assets.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Leases in which we are the lessor are primarily within our Automotive segment and Real Estate segment.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: Refer to Note 12, "Leases," for additional information regarding our operating leases.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: In addition, all of our businesses, including our Real Estate segment, enter into lease arrangements as the lessee.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: The following is our accounting policy for leases in which we are the lessee.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
sentence: All Segments and Holding Company Leases are classified as either operating or financing by the lessee depending on whether or not the lease terms provide for control of the underlying asset to be transferred to the lessee.

name: ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.
